definition: lit. not putting a foot outside/to stay at home

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: We guarantee that you will be able to get any Japan goods without stepping out your doorstep.
sentences.chinese: 我们保证可以令您足不出户便可以买遍全日本货品。

sentences.english: Housewives can do shopping and pay bills without leaving their homes.
sentences.chinese: 家庭主妇可以在足不出户的情况下购物和支付账单。

sentences.english: Canine Distemper and Rabies can affect ferrets that never set foot outdoors.
sentences.chinese: 即使貂宝宝足不出户也有机会感染犬瘟热和狂犬病。

sentences.english: The world is a book. He who stays at home reads but one page.
sentences.chinese: 世界是一本书，足不出户者仅读一页而已。

sentences.english: On second thought, you can still look for the person of your dreams without leaving your house.
sentences.chinese: 再三思量，你足不出户也可以找到自己的梦中情人。

sentences.english: His illness has left him completely house-bound.
What short- and long-term effects do you see cocooning having on consumer spending?
sentences.chinese: 足不出户对消费者支出有什么短期和长期影响？

definition: to enjoy/to live it up/pleasure/CL:種|种[zhong3]
to go online/to connect to the Internet/(of a document etc) to be uploaded to the Internet/(tennis, volleyball etc) to move in close to the net
What you see is what you get (WYSIWYG)
to eat, drink and be merry (idiom)/to abandon oneself to a life of pleasure
